page.title: 03POINTON-FARMING
page.content: {FARMING Farming dominates local life. The land is either flat fenland or gently undulating and the soil is extremely fertile. A hundred years ago Lincolnshire Long Wool sheep, famous for the great weight and long staple of their fleeces, flourished in this area. The Pointon Flock, bred and improved by the Casswell family since 1771, was dispersed in December 1912. The highest price they received for a ram was 500 guineas, an enormous sum at that time and known as the Pointon Record.Although there are still flocks of sheep in the area,arable farming has now taken over.Hedges have been ripped out and great fields of wheat,barley,potatoes,peas,onions, brassicas and rape dominate the landscape.
